institution: Human Resources Development Service of Korea
category: Continuing employment incentive payment and operating rules/Article 3 (Definition of terms)
contents: Article 3 (Definition of Terms) The definitions of terms used in this rule are as follows. 1. Continuing Employment Incentive (hereinafter referred to as *Incentive) refers to a person selected as a Korean master craftsman pursuant to Article 18 of the Decree or an international award. This refers to the amount paid to those who placed in the top 3 in the Skills Olympics competition and who have continuously worked in the relevant occupation for one year as of June 30th of each year., 2. Applicants are those who have been selected as a master craftsman of the Republic of Korea or Among those who placed in the top 3 at the International Skills Olympics Competition, it refers to a person who satisfies the conditions for payment of incentives, such as having continuously worked in the relevant occupation for one year as of June 30th of each year. In order to receive incentives pursuant to Article 14 Paragraph 1, Article 19 Paragraph 1 of the Decree, and Article 13 Paragraph 1 of the Enforcement Rules, a person who wishes to receive incentives must submit an application for continuous employment incentive payment in Form No. 15 of the Enforcement Rules Annex (hereinafter referred to as *Application Form). ) and supporting documents are submitted within the application deadline., 4. Payment recipient refers to a person for whom payment of incentives has been decided after review of the application submitted in accordance with Article 19 of the Enforcement Decree. 5. The period of continuous employment refers to the period from July 1 of the previous year to June 30 of the current year.
